intro: Ruellia angusta, commonly known as narrowleaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, narrow leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Ruellia angusta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
